title: Weeshie Fogarty
text:
Aloysius "Weeshie" Fogarty (March 1941 – 18 November 2018) was an Irish <a href="Gaelic%20football">Gaelic football</a>er, referee and <a href="Sports%20broadcasting">sports broadcaster</a>. His <a href="National%20Football%20League%20%28Ireland%29">league</a> and <a href="All-Ireland%20Senior%20Football%20Championship">championship</a> career with the <a href="Kerry%20GAA">Kerry</a> senior team lasted three seasons from 1969 to 1971.
Biography.
Born in <a href="Cork%20%28city%29">Cork</a>, Fogarty played competitive Gaelic football in his youth and first appeared for the <a href="Killarney%20Legion%20GAA">Killarney Legion</a> club at underage levels, before winning several <a href="East%20Kerry%20Senior%20Football%20Championship">divisional senior championship</a> medals. With the divisional <a href="East%20Kerry%20GAA">East Kerry</a> team he won an <a href="All-Ireland%20Senior%20Club%20Football%20Championship">All-Ireland</a> medal as a non-playing substitute in 1971. Fogarty also won two <a href="Munster%20Senior%20Club%20Football%20Championship">Munster</a> medals and four <a href="Kerry%20Senior%20Football%20Championship">county senior championship</a> medals.
Fogarty made his debut on the inter-county scene at the age of seventeen when he was selected for the Kerry minor team in 1959. He enjoyed one championship season with the minor team, however, he was a <a href="Munster%20Minor%20Football%20Championship">Munster</a> runner-up. Fogarty subsequently joined the Kerry under-21 team, winning a <a href="Munster%20Under-21%20Football%20Championship">Munster</a> medal in 1962. As a member of the Kerry junior team, he won an <a href="All-Ireland%20Junior%20Football%20Championship">All-Ireland</a> medal in 1967. Fogarty later joined the Kerry senior team when he was added to the panel for the <a href="1969%20All-Ireland%20Senior%20Football%20Championship">1969 championship</a>. Over the course of the next few seasons, he won one <a href="All-Ireland%20Senior%20Football%20Championship">All-Ireland</a> medal as a non-playing substitute in 1969. He also won one <a href="Munster%20Senior%20Football%20Championship">Munster</a> medal. Fogarty played his last game for Kerry in October 1970 after a serious eye injury ended his inter-county career.
Following his retirement from football, Fogarty served as a referee at the highest levels. He took charge of several county championship finals as well as the All-Ireland final at under-21 level in 1980.
From 1998, Fogarty worked as a sports broadcaster. He worked for <a href="Radio%20Kerry">Radio Kerry</a> where he hosted his own show called "Terrace Talk" on Monday evenings, while he also wrote for "<a href="The%20Kerryman">The Kerryman</a>" newspaper.
He was involved in the documentary "<a href="All%20Ireland%20Day">All Ireland Day</a>" in 2015.
On 18 November 2018, Fogarty died at the age of 77.
